column1: A breast biopsy is the removal of breast tissue to examine it for signs of breast cancer or other disorders.
The biopsy is done in the following way: - The health care provider cleans the area on your breast.
- The doctor makes a very small cut on your breast over the area that needs to be biopsied.
- A small metal clip or needle may be placed into the breast in the area of the biopsy to mark it, if needed.
Ice and pressure are applied to the site to stop any bleeding.
Use acetaminophen (Tylenol) or ibuprofen (Advil) to relieve pain.
Two main types of breast cancer may be found: - Ductal carcinoma starts in the tubes (ducts) that move milk from the breast to the nipple.
- Lobular carcinoma starts in parts of the breast called lobules, which produce milk.
